history.text: Hello
Hi. What did you think of Bruce Almighty?
It is one of my favorite Jim Carrey movies. It had that Ace Ventura style humor but didn't rely solely on slap stick scenes to make you laugh.
What was your favorite scene form the movie?
from*
I can see what you mean. It isn't a personal favorite of mine, but I tend to shy away from some of his comedies in general. I'm not a big fan of anything with much slapstick at all.
I like that he was given the opportunity to have the job of God though. It did have some deeper meaning that I enjoyed.
Liar Liar might triumph over this movie now that I think about it, but I still think they are both great in their own ways.
I'm surprised at how low of a score it has on Rotten Tomatoes!
That's very true. It had a deeper meaning than most of his other comedies. People can always complain about other peoples duties til they are doing it themselves.
That's very true.
I know, 5.7 is very low. Then again it's based off of peoples opinions. What matters is what you think of the movie.
Do you have a second movie synopsis now? I just got a blank second page on my screen.
I did. Basically it describes a key scene where Bruce is passed up for the opportunity for Anchor by Evan Baxter.
Oh, okay. I remember that scene vaguely. I haven't seen the movie in a long time.
Also mentions the crush he had on Susan Ortega although he was in a relationship with Grace.
Oh, I don't remember that at all.
Was he engaged to Grace?
He was. Took him the whole movie to do it. She was lead on to believe many times during the movie that he was going to propose but he was being selfish.
Her friend made her feel he was going to propose too. She got her hopes up  even more so when he took her out for dinner to tell her he got anchor, she was happy but disappointed at the same time.
Have you seen the sequel Evan Almighty?
I haven't watched it yet
Ah, that's right. I just got the synopsis on my screen. I had forgotten a lot of the movie. I just read about the prayer e-mail system he set up. That was pretty funny.
I have not seen that one.
I heard that it was good though.
Yeah. He set up the prayer email and then eventually he could hear peoples prayers in his head.
Do you remember him finding Jimmy Hoffa in the movie? Funny!
It was driving him crazy at the beginning because he wasn't used to it.
yes!
Then he planted the drugs in the other news anchors van.
Hilarious. I guess I need to watch it again. I would probably enjoy it more than I remember.
I think we are supposed to be talking about the key scene in the passage.
lol
The rules are kind of long winded and I can't remember every thing 100% but let's discuss it the best you can remember so we both get paid lol.
Okay.. trying. I am confused about it though. So, it's sweet that Bruce prays for Grace to find a man that makes her truly happy.
Yes. It proved he went from being selfish to learning what he took for granted, his girlfriend.
I liked the take on saying "yes" to every prayer. It really makes you think about  prayer and the kinds of things  people pray for versus what is actually best.
He was using his powers selfishly at first but then he realized at  the end he didn't need to be powerful to live a fulfilling life.
Yes. I suppose it's essentially a redemption story, isn't it?

Very true. If God answered yes to every prayer, than someone praying for their moth
er in law to jump out the window might get his wish. Their's consequences to easy outs.
More or less.
there's

uid2response.feedback: The other user abandoned the conversation suddenly after a while, before we were able to complete the full conversation.
